intro: Lightfootia ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's lightfoot, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Lightfootia ellenbeckii is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
